result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy J. Magnus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Deg. Sex Assault-Intoxicated Victim, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(cm).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution to be held open and the bond is to held until restitution is established.
AMENDED 02/26/2018 Restitution of $843.33 added.  Remaining bond will be applied to costs and fees in this case,

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request
Defendant it to complete a Sex Offender Assessment and comply with recommended treatment, releasing all records to his agent.  Defendant is to comply with requirements of the Sex Offender Registration  laws.

The defendant shall have no contact with the victims of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
Defendant is not to be employed with health care or any patient care.  All employment must be approved by his agent.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

The defendant shall have no contact with  W.B., A.F., R.N., S.H. E.S., K.S., H.B., and J.K. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant is not to maintain employment in the Health Care Profession or any other employment that involves contact with third parties.  Defendant is to cooperate with the Department of Safety and Professional Services, including the Board of Nursing.    Defendant must contact the Clark County Sheriff's Department within 48 hours to schedule and complete at the date and time designated by the Sheriff's Department, the booking process, which includes fingerprinting and photos.
